result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffery D Bush was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Failure to Support Child (120 Days+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.22(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Deft must follow all terms and conditions of the Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement filed on 3/11/2020.

supervisions.notes: Department of Corrections to garnish the maximum amount of any wages and apply garnishment to Restitution.  Any unpaid balance of Restitution will be carried over to Extended Supervision.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffery D Bush

09:31 AM - case called.  Defendant Jeffery D Bush in court, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail via Zoom with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer via Zoom.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin in Person.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison - this is a victim rights case.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard.  Statement made by victims.  Argument by Atty Bayne-Allison/Atty Restemayer regarding sentencing.  Statement by the Defendant.  Statement by the Court.  Court orders 3 years and 6 months to the Wisconsin State Prison System consisting of 18 months of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision; conditions of the sentence are restitution in the amount of $84,555.05, provide a DNA sample and cc/sc.  Court further orders the $1,400.00 cash bond be applied to the restitution.  Court further orders the Department of Corrections to garnish the maximum amount of any wages.  55 days sentence credit.  Court finds the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Substance Abuse Program.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Sentencing hearing on May 7, 2021 at 09:30 am.

02:01 PM - case called.  Defendant Jeffery D Bush in court, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail with attorney Christopher Michael Restemayer, specially.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties appear via Zoom.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison - this is a victim rights case; status of this matter.  State requests warrant be quashed.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court will quash warrant.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard - no response.  Statement by Atty Restemayer regarding bond.  Response by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court sets bond.  Court notes DEJ has already been revoked.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2021 at 09:30 am.

03:30 PM - case called.  Attorney James Alan Wedemeyer appeared.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties appear via Zoom.  Defendant fails to appear.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding status of this matter.  State did object to the Defendant's request for an adjournment.  Court will not approve of the request for adjournment.  State is requesting a warrant - body only - Nationwide.  Statement by Atty Wedemeyer.  Statement by the Court.  Court will issue a bench warrant - body only - Nationwide.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard.  Statement made by the Victim.  Statement by the Court.

10:33 AM - case called.  Defendant Jeffery D Bush in court with attorney James Alan Wedemeyer.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Victim appeared.  Parties appear via Zoom.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding State's motion to revoke the deferred entry of judgment.  Court questions Atty Bayne-Allison regarding failure to make payments.  Response by Atty Bayne-Allison - last payment was May 2nd.  Statement by Atty Wedemeyer - Defendant had difficulties getting his updated medical report to retain his CDL.  Court questions Atty Wedemeyer regarding last payment being May 2nd.  Response by Atty Wedemeyer - client acknowledges last payment was May 2nd but needed his medical evaluation as his CDL is on hold; Defendant to meet with DOT later this week.  Response by Atty Bayne-Allison - requests the Court revoke the deferred entry of judgment and set this matter for sentencing.  Court questions if there are any victims appearing that wish to be heard.  Statement by the Victim.  Statement by the Court.  Court will grant the State's motion to revoke and order a judgment of conviction be entered on Count 1.  Statement by Atty Bayne-Allison regarding sentencing.  Response by Atty Wedemeyer - not prepared for sentencing.  Court questions Atty Wedemeyer regarding an in person sentencing hearing.  Response by the Defendant - in Indiana.  Court questions Victim regarding sentencing.  Response by the Victim.  Court will set this matter for a sentencing hearing - next hearing Defendant to appear in person; all other parties via Zoom.  Bond will continue.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 13, 2021 at 03:30 pm.
Instructions for How to Appear Remotely
Motion hearing on November 30, 2020 at 10:30 am.

Motion hearing scheduled for November 30, 2020 at 10:30 am.

11:01 AM - case called.  Attorney James Alan Wedemeyer appeared.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant fails to appear.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison - Defendant is supposed to be present in person but Defendant spoke to Branch 1 judicial assistant about not coming to court today.  Statements by Atty Wedemeyer - spoke to his client on Friday; Defendant does not have vacation time to take in order to make it to court - can appear via telephone.  Court questions counsel regarding payments.  Response by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Response by Atty Wedemeyer.  Court questions the State regarding Defendant's failure to appear.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison - no payments being made if Defendant is in custody.  Response by Atty Wedemeyer regarding employment may become closer.  Statements by the Court.  Atty Wedemeyer provides payment history provided to the Court.  Court questions Atty Bayne-Allison regarding motion to revoke DEJ.  Response by Atty Bayne-Allison - Defendant needs to enter into a new DEJ or charges will be filed.  Response by Atty Wedemeyer.  Court questions Atty Wedemeyer regarding when Defendant can appear in Court.  Response by Atty Wedemeyer.  Statements by the Court - Defendant had notice of today's hearing and fails to appear.  Court will issue a bench warrant - body only to be executed at 2:00 p.m. on March 11, 2020.  Response by Atty Wedemyer.  Statements by the Court. Defendant, Jeffery D Bush appeared.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison - motion to revoke DEJ.  State asks agreement be revoked and determine if bond necessary.  Defendant is working and made a payment.  Court questions total amount of child support due.  Responses by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court addresses Defendant - right to counsel.  Statements by Defendant - he believes he owes $26,500 after communication with child support.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison.  Court is going to adjourn this matter so Defendant can have time to obtain counsel.  This will be the last adjournment for this motion to revoke.  Defendant may appear by telephone at the scheduling conference.  Defendant updated his address and phone on the record.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 21, 2019 at 10:00 am.

Defendant, Jeffery D Bush appeared via telephone.  Galen Bayne-Allison appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called.  Statements by Atty Bayne-Allison - motion hearing on State's motion to revoke DEJ and enter judgment of conviction.  Court addresses Defendant.  Statements by Defendant - did not have notice of hearing.  Defendant is in TX and needs 10 days to request time off.  Right to counsel.  Defendant couldn't afford attorney he had.  Statements by Defendant - child support has started taking $350.00 a week from his paycheck.  Statements by Defendant regarding his understanding of revocation of DEJ.  Statements by Court.  State does not object to short adjournment to have Defendant present.  Court is going to adjourn this matter so Defendant can make arrangements to be in Court in person.  State notes that Defendant can pay amounts due and owing to child support before that hearing.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Motion hearing on November 26, 2018 at 03:30 pm.
